sense.learnerExample: Learner example: He became world-famous when he won the Oscar award for best song last year. First Certificate in English; B2; Spanish

sense.def: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing
dictionaryExamples: Were you aware of the risks at the time?
I wasn't even aware that he was ill.
She was well aware that he was married.
I suddenly became aware of him looking at me.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: First of all, we aren't aware of the necessity of learning such things as biology or math. First Certificate in English; B2; Polish

sense.def: when you know about something
dictionaryExamples: Environmental awareness is increasing all the time.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: Thirdly, I have a strong awareness of issues which are important to my local community. Certificate in Advanced English; C1; Chinese

sense.def: in a different place, position or situation
dictionaryExamples: Just go away and leave me alone!
Would you like your burger to eat in or take out?
She's away on vacation until the end of the week.
Keep/Stay away from him.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: I have [an] important exam on your wedding day [in] another city far away from my city. Skills for Life (Entry 2); A2; Farsi

sense.def: at a particular distance from a place
dictionaryExamples: The nearest town was ten miles away.
The office is a half-hour drive away.
We live 5 miles away from the ocean.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: I like it because its remote control could control distances [of] 1 or 2 meters away. Key English Test; A2; Bengali

sense.def: in or into the usual or a suitable place, especially one that can be closed
dictionaryExamples: Could you put the ice-cream away in the freezer?
My grandparents had money hidden away in an old shoe box.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: I am going to put all the toys away. Preliminary English Test; B1; Chinese

sense.def: at a particular time in the future
dictionaryExamples: My English exam's only a week away and I haven't even started to prepare.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: Christmas is just a few months away, and I do not inten[d] to spend it all alone like in the past few years, so I am writing to invite you [to] my real Christmas party without my parents. First Certificate in English; B2; Portuguese

sense.def: gradually disappearing until mostly or completely gone
dictionaryExamples: All the snow had melted away.
The music faded away as the procession moved slowly up the street.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: I always feel so fatigued at the end of the day but after a mile, the aches of the day seem to fade away. First Certificate in English; B2; Hungarian

sense.def: If a sports team is playing away, the game is at the place where the other team usually plays.
dictionaryExamples: They were playing away.

sense.def: used after a verb to mean "continuously" or "repeatedly"
dictionaryExamples: Chris was hammering away in the garden all day.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: They chatted away for a while as Malcolm had to wait for the airport taxi. Certificate of Proficiency in English; C2; Swedish

sense.def: a feeling of great respect and sometimes fear
dictionaryExamples: I was filled with awe at the sheer size of the building.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: As a child growing up, the presence of my grandmother filled me with awe. Certificate of Proficiency in English; C2; Greek

sense.def: to feel great respect for and sometimes fear of someone
dictionaryExamples: As children we were rather in awe of our grandfather.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: As I was the eldest of [the] siblings, they used to respect all my orders and [even] now, they are a bit in awe of me. Certificate of Proficiency in English; C2; Polish

sense.def: extremely good
dictionaryExamples: Your new haircut is awesome.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: My birthday party was awesome! Key English Test; A2; Portuguese

sense.def: great or special and causing deep feelings of admiration, respect, or sometimes fear
dictionaryExamples: an awesome achievement
The scenery was truly awesome.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: Italy is crowded by groups sheepishly following their guide[s] in an awesome silence and respect. Certificate of Proficiency in English; C2; Italian

sense.def: very bad, of low quality, or unpleasant
dictionaryExamples: The weather was awful.
She's got an awful boss.
It's an awful place.
She'd been ill and she looked awful.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: We wanted to go shopping in Oxford Street but everything is too expensive and the weather was awful. Preliminary English Test; B1; French

sense.def: a very large amount
dictionaryExamples: It cost an awful lot of money.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: First of all, I want to highlight that we see an awful lot of mobile phone[s] in our daily life. First Certificate in English; B2; French

sense.def: difficult or causing problems
dictionaryExamples: an awkward shape
Some of the questions were awkward.
The large box was awkward to carry.

sense.def: embarrassing and not relaxed
dictionaryExamples: an awkward situation
She's put me in quite an awkward position.
There was an awkward silence.
They'd chosen an awkward time to call as I was just about to leave.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: Not a movement, not a voice, just an awkward silence. First Certificate in English; B2; Spanish

sense.def: without beauty, ease, and skill when moving
dictionaryExamples: He’s too awkward – he’ll never be a good dancer.
sense.learnerExample: Learner example: Piggy's "value" is not apparent to the boys because it is concealed by the sight of his awkward self: he is plump, he wears thick spectacles, he is not gifted with good health. Certificate of Proficiency in English; C2; Italian
